data.title: From Robert Redford to Ben Kingsley, the MCU has attracted some of the greatest actors of all time, and you didn’t notice
data.meta_description: Robert Redford, Michael Douglas, Ben Kingsley, Anthony Hopkins have all made the MCU a large assembly of impeccable talent. | Hollywood
data.text:
Looking back at 22 movies, you will realise that while the leads were played by charming actors like Robert Downey Jr, Evans, Pratt and others, there were also a few senior and legendary actors. These actors not only gave the leads the support they needed but also brought a gravity and respectability to the movie that no other actor could have. From parental figures to scheming supervillains, they played their parts to perfection and were still able to not make the movie about themselves despite the reservoir of talent and experience that they brought with themselves.

Here, we list 15 great, multiple award-winning actors who played pivotal roles in the MCU. Did your favourite make it to the list?

Jeff Bridges in Iron Man

Jeff is a seven time nominee and one time winner of the Academy Award and known for movies like The Big Lebowski and Crazy Heart. He played the main villain, Obadiah Stane in Iron Man.

Tommy Lee Jones in Captain America

Tommy is a four time nominee and one time winner of the Academy Award. He became a household name after working with Will Smith in the sci-fi comedy Men In Black. He is also known for his films like Lincoln and No Country For Old Men. He played Colonel Chester Phillips in Captain America: The First Avenger, the strict supervisor to Steve Rogers.

Anthony Hopkins in Thor

Anthony played Thor’s father and Asgardian god, Odin in the three Thor movies. He has received four Academy award nominations winning one in 1992 for his performance in The Silence of the Lambs. He played one of the most iconic Hollywood characters of all time in the film, Hannibal Lecter.

Glenn Close in Guardians of the Galaxy

Glenn plays the Nova-Prime Irani Rael in Guardians of the Galaxy movies. She was nominated for an Oscar this year for her stellar performance in The Wife. She is also known for playing Cruella de-Vil in 101 Dalmatians.

Kurt Russell in Guardians of the Galaxy Vol II

Kurt played god/planet Ego in Guardians of the Galaxy Vol II. He was the evil father to Chris Pratt’s Peter Quill who leaves him and his mother alone on Earth. Kurt is known for his films like Overboard, Backdraft and Tombstone.

Michael Douglas in Ant-Man

Michael plays brilliant scientist Hank Pym in the Ant-Man movies. He won the Best Actor Academy Award for Wall Street in 1988. He also won the Best Picture Award for One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest in 1976.

Michelle Pfeiffer in Ant-Man and the Wasp

Michelle has won the BAFTA and the Golden Globe awards for her work and she played Hope’s mother in Ant-Man and the Wasp. She is known for playing Catwoman in Batman Returns.

Ben Kingsley in Iron Man 3

Ben played a silly British actor pretending to be supervillain Mandarin in Iron Man 3. He has been nominated for the Academy Award four times and has won it for Gandhi. He is also known for Hugo and Schindler’s List.

Robert Redford in Captain America: Winter Soldier

Robert Redford portrayed villain Alexander Pierce in Captain America: The Winter Soldier. He is known for classics like Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid and All the President’s Men. He won the Oscar one for Best Director and another Lifetime Achievement award.

Angela Bassett in Black Panther

Angela plays T’challa’s mother, Queen Ramonda in Black Panther.She is know for playing Tina Turner in the biopic What’s Love Got to Do with It. She was nominated for the Academy Award for it.

Forrest Whittaker in Black Panther

Forrest played Zuri in the film. For his performance as Ugandan dictator Idi Amin in the 2006 film The Last King of Scotland, Whitaker won the Academy Award, BAFTA Award, Golden Globe Award, National Board of Review Award, Screen Actors Guild Award.

Michael Keaton in Spider-Man: Homecoming

Michael played the villain Vulture in Spider-Man: Homecoming. He is also known for playing Batman in the Tim Burton series of movies on the dark knight. He was nominated for Best Actor Academy Award for Birdman.

Tilda Swinton in Doctor Strange

Tilda played the Ancient One in Doctor Strange, originally a male character in the comics. She won the Best Supporting Actress Academy Award for Michael Clayton. She also played the iconic White Witch in The Chronicles of Narnia.

Jeff Goldblum in Thor: Ragnarok

Jeff played the whimsical and sadistic Grandmaster in Thor: Ragnarok. He is known for his work in movies like Jurassic Park and Independence Day.
